Message.Title: In Feb 2009 Obama promised to cut national debt in half
Message.Msg: during his first term in office. The National Debt is now over $16 trillion. Although the republican led House passed and submitted numerous budgets to the Senate for approval to curb spending, the Democrat led Senate has not passed a budget in over 3 years. In March 2012, the House decided to let Obama's budget for a vote which was unanimously voted down, 0-414 in the House and 0-97 in the Senate. What an embarrassment to our failure-in-chief! Mainstream news and wannabees like Yahoo just ignored it. see article in the dailycaller

Message.Title: Reses Hire
Message.Msg: Ms. Reses served as Chief Executive Officer of iBuilding Inc., a real estate software business that was sold to Realeum. Previously, she served as a Principal at Doughty Hanson & Co., focusing on media and technology investments. Ms. Reses has also spent over seven years at Goldman Sachs as a Vice President in its mergers and acquisitions advisory group and principal investment area. She was employed at Goldman Sachs Group, Merchant Banking Division. Her investment experience at Goldman Sachs Capital Partners includes numerous transactions in the retail, media, and technology sectors. She serves as a Director at NAMG, Inc., NEP, HIT Entertainment, and also serves as an Advisor to a number of other Apax's portfolio media companies. She serves as Director of Trend Technologies LLC. Ms. Reses served as a Director of Cengage Learning Holdco Inc., a subsidiary of Cengage Learning GP I LLC from June 2007 to September 2007. Ms. Reses served as a Director, Cengage Learning GP I LLC - the general partner of Cengage Learning Holdings II L.P. since September 2007. At Doughty Hanson, She served as Director of North American Membership Group and Trend Technologies, LLC. She served as a Director of iBuilding Inc. Ms. Reses received a #$%$ in Economics with honors from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Message.Title: Yahoo shares worth more and more as time goes by...
Message.Msg: As Yahoo keeps buying back its shares with cash generated from its core business every year ($1.36B/year, not to mention the cash return from Alibaba, that's $15B! It could almost buy out all of the outstanding Yahoo shares at current price!!!), Yahoo outstanding shares has dropped from 1.3B(last year) to now 1.18B, Yahoo shares would worth more and more as time goes by... This year, at current price, Yahoo could easily buy back another 100M shares which would reduce its outstanding shares to 1.1B, next year 1B...

Topic.Title: Yahoo does not trade like this. Something is going on in the background

Message.Msg: Jack Ma might need partners but if he paid $26 (approx. $31 bil) for all YHOO and assuming a $65 bil Alibaba Group IPO in 2013, which would put YHOOs 40% of AG at $26 bil, then Ma could trade Y-Jap shares with Son for more AG shares, sell the YHOO core and patents to MSFT (or someone) and end out making himself $7 bil or so in the net deal, (and owning a lot of AG). It would work with a lower ( $50 bil.?) AG IPO price as well. And I left out YHOO's present cash of over $2 bil.

Message.Title: What are the BEST Financial Message Boards, now that Yahoo has made its own Mediocre at best?

Do not like the new format. can anyone suggest ACTIVE message boards on some other site that have features similar to Yahoo's excellent old boards? Thanks in advance! (Maybe Yahoo will get the hint and switch back--otherwise, mass migration of many users probably).

Topic.Title: YAHOO FINALLY BLOCKED THE SPAMMERS!!!!!!!

Message.Msg: Maybe they got rid of some of the spammers, but I think they have made these boards much less interesting and useful in the process.

Topic.Title: What are the BEST Financial Message Boards, now that Yahoo has made its own Mediocre at best?

Message.Msg: Here is just one example of how these boards are less useful. You could click on a topic thead on the old board, and up would pop all the messages under that thread. You could read some, aand ignore others. I also like the red star rating system, although of course it was abused by spammers. It was also possible to add non spam links to back up your message argument. You could also easily track the message history of a poster, from most recent going back. If you found someone with something halfway intelligent to say, you could go back and read all his messages on all the boards. can't do that anymore, evidently. These are big losses just to get rid of some spam!

Topic.Title: YAHOO FINALLY BLOCKED THE SPAMMERS!!!!!!!

Message.Msg: Indeed the Spammers are gone but so are the regular posters including me. If anyone comes up with other stock message boards pleas post the location.

Topic.Title: YAHOO CENSORING MESSAGES CRITICIZING NEW MESSAGE BOARD FORMAT?

Message.Msg: If your post was a reply, click the "see replies" tag at the bottom. Not all replies are shown by default. I too dislike the new format. Rather than rant, give them feedback using the feedback bar at the bottom. They already have changed one thing that I and likely many others have suggested and that's adding the "Get message board for" to jump to another MB directly. Another is that we cannot see the ID of the latest reply or jump directly to that reply. The most controversial is that URL (links) are not allowed anymore. No way to backup a claim or statement or point to background information such as a 10Q. I will reduce SPAM since if no links SPAMers have way to get you to their site. There may be a way around it. Don't curse - light a candle (under them).

Message.Title: Thank you YHOO for distroying message boards. They really were worthless.

Message.Title: Total Message postings seem to have sharply declined with the new format
Message.Msg: I check out several boards each day. On many (most?) of them (CMG, AMZN, TBT, SLV, YHOO etc.) the total daily number of new messages and message threads has sharply declined since the new format was introduced. At first I thought it was seasonal (Labor day) but the decline has continued. Yahoo--can you put 2 and 2 together and see that you losing people here (not just spammers)? Seriously consider bringing back the old board format, or I think you will soon hear crickets chirping since they will be deserted.

Message.Title: "IF IT A'INT BROKE, FIX IT"

Topic.Title: ruining message boards

Message.Msg: boards are full of spam and political #$%$ not much good for exchange of thoughts anyways

Topic.Title: Total Message postings seem to have sharply declined with the new format

Message.Msg: I, too, liked the old board format, bringing it back would not be the end of the world for Yahoo (i.e. admitting the mistake made). If they must keep the new format, make the listing more like a tree, give user options at the top or on the side to dynamically make fonts larger or smaller, the idea is to fit more messages within a viewing area; Also please make the message panes auto expand or shrink horizontally. How come there is no option to choose to show 10 or 20 or 100 messages? On ESPN site, users can hit the pause button to "freeze" the message updates, it is pretty neat.

Topic.Title: Total Message postings seem to have sharply declined with the new format

Message.Msg: If Yahoo is based on eyes on and clicks, they have made a very bad move!! ETrade and Toyota will not pay for fewer clicks!!!
